content.title: Superior Mesenteric Artery Aneurysm
content.description: 5-8% of visceral aneurysms, often mycotic in origin historically.

clinical_features.presentation: Often incidental; may present with abdominal pain or GI bleeding if ruptured

treatment.endovascular_limited: Challenging due to branch involvement and need to maintain intestinal perfusion

content.clinical_pearl: Mycotic SMA aneurysms require excision with bowel coverage, not endovascular treatment, due to infection risk
content.statement: Superior Mesenteric Artery Aneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
